Mar 31, 2002

Facts and Figures from this Week’s Times

According to the Times is a Web-only feature highlighting facts and figures culled from the week’s news. It appears on Thursdays.

Mar 29, 2002

Pakistan’s Tribal Leaders Send Warning to US

(NYTimes) Tribal leaders from the treacherous mountainous areas along the border with Afghanistan have an unambiguous message for American commanders who have suggested that they might enter the region in pursuit of Al Qaeda fighters: Don’t…. That warning must be taken seriously; ages ago, Alexander the Great was turned back, and fo...

Mar 29, 2002

Blogg Tools

If you are looking for tools to run your own blog, I have a section on my bookmarks page. Some of the tools are free, and some are very easy to run and even come with free web space to post your blog!

Mar 29, 2002

Arafat under middle-of-house arrest

(Guardian) Israeli troops have taken over Yasser Arafat’s headquarters, switched off the electricity and telephone and confined him to one floor of the building. (Also, the BBC)

Mar 28, 2002

Zimbabwe struck by new reign of terror

(Guardian) Dr Francis Lovemore, medical director of the Amani Trust human rights group in Harare, says sexual assaults or forced sexual humiliation by the army and militias are now central weapons of the terror.

The Nation regularly reports on, investigates and analyzes the Israeli-Palestinian conflict. We’ve devoted this special web page to related material on the Middle East. Mar 28, 2002

Ruling threatens Internet Radio

(Salon) A new ruling involving the Digital Millennium Copyright Act is set to wipe out independent online music stations.
